title: Hashing Benchmarks slow down Startup Considerably

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
I just did some tests to see how we can speedup the Syncthing start on Android. For that, I added log statements around the following code block in main.go:
```
sha256.SelectAlgo()
sha256.Report()
perfWithWeakHash := cpuBench(3, 150*time.Millisecond, true)
l.Infof("Hashing performance with weak hash is %.02f MB/s", perfWithWeakHash)
perfWithoutWeakHash := cpuBench(3, 150*time.Millisecond, false)
l.Infof("Hashing performance without weak hash is %.02f MB/s", perfWithoutWeakHash)
```

According to the logs, this takes more than 3 seconds to run on my Nexus 5. When I commented these lines out and hardcoded `weakhash.Enabled = false`, the app was available almost instantly.

From what I can see, there is no way to disable the benchmarks via parameters or config. So there are a few options:
- add an option, to disable all benchmarks (via environment variable or parameter)
- run the benchmark only on first start, and cache the result as long as the CPU doesn't change (but that will still slow down the initial start)
- optimize the benchmark, so that it runs much faster
- run the benchmark asynchronously, so it doesn't block startup (but that would still be a waste of cpu/battery)

### Version Information

Syncthing Version: v0.14.32
OS Version: Android 6
